snippet: When the Afghan spy agency trumpeted the death of an Islamic State recruiter, it distributed a photograph of a man who was actually a former Guantánamo detainee who was trying to lie low.
abstract: Afghan spy agency accidentally provides wrong photograph to news organizations following airstrike killing of prominent Islamic State recruiter Mullah Abdul Rauf Khadim; man in photograph is actually Kandahar resident Shawali Khan, who is attempting to quietly readjust to life following 12 years of detention at Guantanamo Bay, Cuba; Khan's lawyers brought mistake to attention of news organizations.

byline.original: By TAIMOOR SHAH and JOSEPH GOLDSTEIN
byline.contributor: Taimoor Shah reported from Kandahar, and Joseph Goldstein from Kabul, Afghanistan. Azam Ahmed contributed reporting from Kabul.

lead_paragraph: When the Afghan spy agency trumpeted the death of an Islamic State recruiter, it distributed a photograph of a man who was actually a former Guantánamo detainee who was trying to lie low.

headline.main: The Afghan Militant in the Photo? The Wrong Man, and He’s Not Happy
headline.print_headline: The Afghan Militant in the Photo? The Wrong Man, and He’s Not Happy

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
